options.text: Dynamic stability is possible only when the aeroplane is statically stable about the relevant axis.
A dynamically stable aeroplane would be almost impossible to fly manually.
Dynamic stability about the lateral axis implies that after being displaced from its original equilibrium condition, the aeroplane will return to that condition without oscillation.
Static stability means that the aeroplane is also dynamically stable about the relevant axis.

options.text: pitch-up moment and the effect is destabilising.
pitch-down moment and the effect is stabilising.
pitch-down moment and the effect is destabilising.
pitch-up moment and the effect is stabilising.

variant.question: What is the effect of elevator trim tab adjustment on the static longitudinal stability of an aeroplane?

options.text: No effect.
Depends on the value of stick force/g.
Aeroplane nose up trim increases the static longitudinal stability.
Aeroplane nose down trim increases the static longitudinal stability.

variant.question: A medium range jet aircraft has its cargo load displaced to a location further aft than on the expected loadsheet. The stabilizer trim setting has been corrected for this error. What is most likely to happen during take off?

options.text: There will be a tendency for the aircraft to over rotate and a possible tail strike
The flight controls are reversed. A push will now be required to overcome the over rotating moment
Stick force is reduced
Stick force is increased

variant.question: A medium range jet aircraft has its cargo load displaced to a location further aft than on the expected loadsheet. The stabilizer trim setting has not been corrected for this error. What is most likely to happen during take off?

options.text: There will be a tendency for the aircraft to over rotate and a possible tail strike
Stick force is reduced
Stick force is increased
The flight controls are reversed. A push will now be required to overcome the over rotating moment

variant.question: What is the effect on the aeroplanes static longitudinal stability of a shift of the centre of gravity to a more aft location and on the required control deflection for a certain pitch up or down?

options.text: The static longitudinal stability is smaller and the required control deflection is smaller
The static longitudinal stability is larger and the required control deflection is smaller
The static longitudinal stability is larger and the required control deflection is larger
The static longitudinal stability is smaller and the required control deflection is larger

variant.question: What is the effect on the aeroplane's static longitudinal stability of a shift of the centre of gravity to a more aft location and on the required control deflection for a certain pitch up or down?

options.text: The static longitudinal stability is smaller and the required control deflection is smaller
The static longitudinal stability is smaller and the required control deflection is larger
The static longitudinal stability is larger and the required control deflection is smaller
The static longitudinal stability is larger and the required control deflection is larger

variant.question: Consider a conventional aeroplane with under-slung engines. In steady, straight and level flight the lift force from the wing is greatest when the aeroplane’s CG is ...

options.text: forward within the acceptable range and the engines are at a low thrust setting.
aft within the acceptable range and the engines are at a high thrust setting.
aft within the acceptable range and the engines are at a low thrust setting.
forward within the acceptable range and the engines are at a high thrust setting.

variant.question: One advantage of mounting the horizontal tailplane on top of the vertical fin is:

options.text: To improve the aerodynamic efficiency of the vertical fin.
That it does not require a de-icing system.
To decrease the susceptibility to deep stall.
To decrease fuel consumption by creating a tail-heavy situation.

variant.question: If an aeroplane exhibits insufficient stick force per g, this problem can be resolved by installing:

options.text: a bobweight in the control system which pulls the stick forwards.
a spring which pulls the stick backwards.
a bobweight in the control system which pulls the stick backwards.
a spring which pushes the stick forwards.

variant.question: If the yaw damper is inoperative the pilot must?

options.text: Reduce mach Speed
Pitch Up
Increase Mach Speed
Pitch Down

variant.question: A jet transport aeroplane exhibits pitch up when thrust is suddenly increased from an equilibrium condition, because the thrust line is below the:

options.text: CG.
centre of pressure.
neutral point.
drag line of action.
